issue_title: Temp fix for backup restore with external repos
issue_body:
Before this fix extensions from external repos wouldnt restore properly so you would be left with broken backups.

With this fix it fixes the big issue, but there are still a few issues. First it wont install extensions 100% of the time and therefor wont restore novels for it.

I restored a few more times and it got everything eventually

CommitDetails.method_summarization: The change in the method allows for loading the extensions from a separate repository before restoring them, instead of using the existing backup list.</s> The change in the method involves refactoring the `extensionsRepo.getExtension(2, extensionID)` to use a List comprehension `extensions.find { it.id == extensionID }` instead, and also changing the type of the `extensionsRepo` variable from `Repository<ExtensionEntity>?` to `List<GenericExtensionEntity>`. In summary, the method now uses a List to retrieve an ExtensionEntity instead of using a Repository with a getExtension method.</s> I cannot summarize the alteration without seeing the actual method code before and after the changes. Please provide the code snippets for an accurate one-line summarization.</s> The alteration summed up in one line: The list of extensions was renamed from "extensionsRepo.getExtension(2, extensionID)" to a simpler variable name "extensions" for easier reference in the code.</s>

I'm unable to see the specific lines of code you're referring to for providing an accurate one-line summarization of the alteration. Please provide the context or meaning of the changes for me to help you with that.</s> The alteration adds a log message before installing the extension and changes the installation message in the notification. Moreover, it adds a log message before restoring extension novels.</s>Before changes: Method contained a loop that attempted to restore each novel entity from backup and handled exceptions.

After changes: Method logging message added before loop, restoring novels as before.</s>

issue_title: Temp fix for backup restore with external repos
issue_body:
Before this fix extensions from external repos wouldnt restore properly so you would be left with broken backups.

With this fix it fixes the big issue, but there are still a few issues. First it wont install extensions 100% of the time and therefor wont restore novels for it.

I restored a few more times and it got everything eventually

CommitDetails.method_summarization: The alteration Changes the list of extensions from being called `extensionsRepo.getExtension` to `extensions`, allowing direct usage of the `extensions` list in the method.</s> I'm unable to see the codes before and after the changes in your message. Please provide the context so I can give a meaningful one-line summarization of the alterations.</s> The alteration changes the type of the 'extensionsRepo' variable from 'ExtensionsRepository' to a List of 'GenericExtensionEntity' named 'extensions'. This allows the method to directly search and access the extension Entity by using the 'find' function, instead of using getExtension method. The overall functionality of the method remains the same.</s> Before the changes, the method loaded extensions from a backup and restored them to the repository. After the changes, the method loads extensions from a separate repository and restores them to the main repository.</s>

The changes to the method added a log statement indicating the extension installation and restoration process.</s> Before the changes, the method attempted to restore novels from backup with logging of exceptions. After the changes, the method still attempts to restore novels from backup, but now includes a log statement indicating that extension novels are being restored.</s> I'm unable to see the specific lines of code you're referring to in order to accurately summarize the alteration in one line. Please provide a description or context of what the method did before and after the changes so I can help you understand the meaning of the modification.</s>

issue_body:
Finished a bunch of UI tweaks. Main highlights are
- Padding for click indicators look much better by applying padding after the clickable. This is done by removing padding from parent composables and applying it to the children instead.
- Add animations where possible, like expanding filter menu groups or switching between tabs
- Images now all crossfade between states
- Better image loading error display
- Consistent image loading placeholder
- Add display for languages instead of just showing the language code
- The linear loading indicator now overlays instead of being added between the toolbar and the content
- Use OutlinedTextFields instead of basic TextFields since they look better
- Handle no more content in catelog properly so its not displayed before loading
- Add BackHandler for library selection so it doesnt close the app when trying to deselect
- Replace clickable unread chip with a badge thats not clickable since it doesnt make sense to click it
- Selection background instead of a border for library and chapter list
- Clicking a settings item now starts/toggles/expands that setting
- Clicking a filter item now toggles/expands that filter
- Use a better cover ratio

issue_body:
- **[Add Immutable annotation to UI models](https://github.com/shosetsuorg/shosetsu/commit/86fd6559ea4d13d0b365b418255bb028fd773052)**. Its for describing that the model wont change to the compose compiler, making it generate more optimized code. For this I replaced all var variables with val to guarantee this.
- **[Add UIUpdates UI model for pre-calculated time display](https://github.com/shosetsuorg/shosetsu/commit/9550f49d5cb9530c80441bb6bb02ed04854caf1f)** This allows for the time string to be calculated outside the UI thread, since string formatting is expensive.
- **[Found a extra ComposeView lol](https://github.com/shosetsuorg/shosetsu/commit/891575f2a37f6e8a4613a2c2ddf5c1861a291ee9)**
- **[Use Empty collections where possible](https://github.com/shosetsuorg/shosetsu/commit/f266305953acb1b17af73f09eda91434245e1cfb)** I was seeing a lot of empty collections being made and each of those while dont take much space, have a location in memory. Using the empty collection functions removes those extra allocations.
- **[Improve performance of chapter lists](https://github.com/shosetsuorg/shosetsu/commit/57a3e0bab50dc7f303b79be1950530432e987fef)** by using pre-calculated values for the same reason I added the UI models.
- **[Dont remember derivedStateOf](https://github.com/shosetsuorg/shosetsu/commit/ac30b4929c8aa50a3cd4b9474069ef1440fba311)** derivedStateOf needs to watch values outside the remember function, remembering a derivedStateOf only works if it can directly access the mutableStateOf of the variables
- [**Set MutableStateFlow.value instead of .emit**](https://github.com/shosetsuorg/shosetsu/commit/124ddaae243b95ba9d34ee8bffb9f09ed062d99d) MutableStateFlow is made for watching a state of a value, if you set .value it will first check if its equal to the last value and only emit the new value if its not(since it always emits the latest value on collect, and .emit doesnt set the value, it can emit a old value by accident). You shouldn't use .emit or .tryEmit on a MutableStateFlow, if you need a flow where you can emit independent of the previous value, while keeping track of the last value, you should be using a MutableSharedFlow with a replay value of 1.

issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Yes, downloads will be limited to 999 chapters (based on my understanding of the new update).

**Describe the solution you'd like**
In the 'download' menu, add "range download." This way, we can download chapters 1 thru 999, then after that is finished, we can download chapter 1000 thru 1998, and so on until all chapters are downloaded.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Hit download unread. If limited to 999, then write down your current chapter number(ex: chapter 41) then mark all your downloaded chapters as read, and repeat the process until all chapters are downloaded. Then mark  whatever you didn't read, as unread(ex: selecting chapter 41 thru 2176, and marking them as unread)

**Additional context**
If the downloads are limited to 999 maximum downloads, then having this feature would improve convenience of the app.

CommitDetails.method_summarization: The change in the method handling now catches `LuaError` exceptions and modifies the error message and title in the notification accordingly.</s> It is not possible to provide a one-line summarization without seeing the specific code and understanding the changes made between the before and after versions of the method. Please provide the lines of code for both versions, and I will do my best to give you a meaningful one-line summary.</s>

issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
The menu button to migrate a novel's source to a another source seems to be broken.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open Shosetsu
2. Install at least two extensions
3.  Add a novel (a novel within both shouldn't be necessary)
4. Enter the added novel's chapter list view
5. Click or tap the overflow menu within the novel chapter list view
6. Click or tap the "Migrate source" overflow menu option
7. Experience the suck. Then embrace the suck. A worldview needed for almost everything in life for those who experience sucky situations or events.

**Expected behavior**
The expected behavior is for the user to be able to migrate sources for a novel without experiencing setbacks.

**Screenshots**
I'm getting tired from typing extra details... it should be fine.... maybe?

**Device information:**
 - OS: Android 10 
 - App Version: 2.0.0-2344

**Additional context**
Additional context: As my grandpappy always said, "What a load of bullshit!"

issue_body:
Would be nice to have an Epub converter function in the app.
I don't have a good knowledge on programming and development, so i don't know if it will be possible. But, would be nice to see it in the app. 


Saw that feature in another well developed app called "quick novel".

Here's their github: https://github.com/LagradOst/QuickNovel

P.S:- Thank you very much Developer for making this app. I have been using it for a while and the experience has been really great.
Keep up the good work.
Thanks again for giving us this amazing app.

issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
Search query stays between sources.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Look up anything 
2. Click enter and when you get results close the source
3.  Now when opening a new source it will still look up your previous query.
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
I expected that whenever I open a source that it opens on the default screen and doesn't jump to search results.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Device information:**
 - OS: android 12
 - App Version: 2.0.0-2186

**Additional context**

issue_body:
After 2 years, Shosetsu V2 is on the horizon.

With most of the features I wanted to return returned, I intend to let Shosetsu return to updating properly, as Shosetsu has already been treating development as stable and moved into a state of snapshot releases on matrix as a preview preview.

No more, I am satisfied with the code base quality and I want to move forward. This release will eventually get pushed to google play store after a month more code optimizations and error handling.
.
Upon merge the following will be done, Default branch will be `main`, Release tag will be created, Update file created for old versions, Shosetsu moved to GitLab, Website will target GitLab

issue_title: Implement Paging for loading data from extensions
issue_body:
Implements paging support in regards to catalog and loading data from the Catalog.

Migrates both search & catalog views to using the paging library.

To implement the functionality properly, The app structure had to be fully compressed, thus I am abandoning any initiative for other platforms. Shosetsu will remain an android only application.

Paging completely simplifies my work in regards to the Catalog, allow me to focus on other things then having to maintain load states.

issue_title: [Bug] Back gesture doesn't work properly in reader. [r2050]
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
The back gesture doesn't work in the upper half of the screen in the reader, works normally everywhere else in the app.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open any chapter of any novel.
2. Try to use back gesture on the upper half of the screen.
3. You aren't able to exit out of reader.

**Expected behavior**
You exit out of the reader.

**Device information:**
 - OS: 11
 - App Version: 2.0.0-2050

**Additional context**
The back gesture works fine on the lower half of the screen.

CommitDetails.method_summarization: The method's padding around the content was increased from 8 dp to 16 dp.</s>

The method changes involve removing the assignment of an anonymous function to the variable "onHitBottom" before the condition check on Line 100. This removal simplifies the code, eliminating unnecessary braces and lines, but does not significantly alter the method's functionality.</s> I'm unable to see the before and after method changes in your message. Could you please provide them for me to give a one-line summarization of the alteration?</s>

issue_title: [Bug] Unable to go back if volume scroll enabled.
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
You are unable to use the back gesture in reader if you have volume scroll enabled.
Even with it disabled you are only able to use the back gesture to go out of reader on the lower half.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Enable scroll using volume buttons.
2. Start reading a novel try to go out of reader using the back gesture , you get the animation for the gesture but it doesn't go out of reader. And you have to use the back button in the reader itself to exit it.

**Expected behavior**
It backs out of the reader.

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Device information:**
 - OS: Android 11
 - App Version: r1731 , r1901

**Additional context**
You are only able to use the back gesture on the lower half of the screen with volume scroll disable and not at all with it enabled.

issue_title: white screen in Dark Mode when opening the app (2.0.0-1697)
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
If you have the dark mode on then close the app and then open it again. the first thing you will see is a white screen for a moment (like the Light mode idk) and then the dark mode taking action.
**To Reproduce**
1. set dark mode on the app
2. close the app
3. open it again

**Expected behavior**
the app should not show a white screen for a moment if the dark moment was set previously. what i mean is that the app should be in dark mode all the time. the moment of the white screen burn my eyes when i open the app at night.

**Screenshots**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75091899/152687710-4c969ca5-69d6-4e3e-95fe-f9550b3d9b3d.mp4


**Device information:**
 - OS: android 8
 - App Version: 2.0.0-1697

issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
Installing a certain extension you will not be able to install more extension making the installation system stop working

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Try to insta the extension Rain of Snow Translation
2. try to install another extension
3.  '....'
4. Every installatuon will load forever endlessly

**Expected behavior**
the apl should install itself

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Device information:**
 - OS: android 8
 - App Version: 2.0 1656

**Additional context**
to fix it one must clear the data of the app

The problem with the feature "Jump", which allows getting directly to one chapter from the list of chapters, is that because of the animation it takes some time to get to that chapter. With short novels it's not a problem, but recently I'm reading "The legendary mechanic" and to get to chapter 1000 it takes 13 seconds (I checked) every time I have to get there. If we take even longer novels like "Super Genes" with 3000 chapters it's even longer.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
To either remove the animation and directly get to the chapter, or to shorten the duration of the animation.

issue_title: Fix dropdown text color, unclickable space
issue_body:
Fixes #159

reference: https://foso.github.io/Jetpack-Compose-Playground/material/dropdownmenu/
reference: https://material.io/components/menus#specs
I couldn't find how to style ClickableText, and the example uses Text anyway, so I switched it to that.
Using DropdownMenuItem makes clickable the space to the right of the text and between items, and increases the height of each item from 25dp to 48dp.

CommitDetails.method_summarization: The changes do not appear to have altered the meaning or functionality of the code significantly. Both the before and after versions of the method have the same lines, in the same order, with only minor formatting differences. The method continues to set the ViewTreeLifecycleOwner and ViewTreeSavedStateRegistryOwner for an IT, and apply a ViewCompositionStrategy and set the content of binding.root with MdcTheme and BrowseControllerFilterMenu.</s>The change added a null check before creating and showing the BottomSheetDialog to prevent potential errors when showing the dialog multiple times.</s> There were no observable changes to the meaning of the method based on the provided code snippets. Both versions of the method are setting the ViewTreeLifecycleOwner and ViewTreeSavedStateRegistryOwner for an object and then setting its content using MdcTheme and CatalogFilterMenu.</s> The alteration adds a check to ensure the BottomSheetDialog is not already showing before inflating and setting its content. If it is not showing, then the dialog is inflated, configured and shown.</s> The change added null check and lazy initialization to the BottomSheetDialog object before showing it, while keeping the text and icon setting for the floating action button unchanged.</s>

It is not possible for me to provide a one-line summarization without seeing the actual lines of code in the before and after method changes. Could you please provide the respective code snippets for me to review and make a meaningful summarization?</s> before changes: The method composed a ClickableText, IconToggleButton, and DropdownMenu
after changes: The method replaced ClickableText with a Text, kept the IconToggleButton, and replaced DropdownMenu.items with DropdownMenuItem.</s> The change converts ClickableText and DropdownMenu components to Text and DropdownMenuItem components respectively, improving the readability and reducing the nesting depth of the code.</s> The change converts a ClickableText component into a DropdownMenuItem with the same click functionality.</s>

The alteration does not change the method's overall purpose as it still sets the ViewTreeLifecycleOwner and ViewTreeSavedStateRegistryOwner, applies ViewCompositionStrategy, and sets the content for the binding.root. Therefore, one-line summarization would be: "The method sets up the ViewTreeLifecycleOwner, ViewTreeSavedStateRegistryOwner, applies ViewCompositionStrategy, and sets the content for the binding.root."</s> The alteration adds a check to prevent creating a new BottomSheetDialog if one is already showing before creating a new one.</s> No changes were made to the method logic. The method continues to set the ViewTreeLifecycleOwner and ViewTreeSavedStateRegistryOwner for the given View, apply composition strategy, and set the content using MdcTheme and CatalogFilterMenu. The difference lies only in the indentation and formatting.</s> Before changes: Created and showed a Compose view with a BottomSheetDialog.
After changes: Checked if a BottomSheetDialog already exists, then created and showed it with a Compose view.</s> The changes made to the method resulted in the creation of a new instance of a BottomSheetDialog only when it hasn't already been shown, instead of making a new instance every time the method is called. The logic for showing the dialog remains unchanged.</s>

issue_body: **Describe the bug** These pop-ups can be duplicated by spamming the button that opens them ``` My library→FILTER (record: 6 copies) Browse→FILTER (record: 21 copies) Browse→[extension]→FILTER (record: 4 copies) ``` **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Hold your finger above the screen, where the FILTER button will be 2. Open the app or switch to the My library tab or switch to the Browse tab or open an extension 3. Tap as fast as you can to open duplicate FILTER pop-ups 4. Scroll inside or tap outside the FILTER pop-up to close it and count how many duplicates there were **Expected behavior** A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. **Screenshots** **Device information:** - OS: - App Version: **Additional context** This should not be fixed by replacing the previous pop-ups with the last opened one, because that would make it take longer to be responsive again. It should be fixed by only opening the first pop-up and ignoring future attempts until the first pop-up is closed. relevant code: LibraryController.kt:324 BrowseController.kt:204 CatalogController.kt:319 manipulateFAB()

issue_title: Previous failure doesn't stop current extension install
issue_body:
Fixes #161 
Fixes #163
![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1996449/143327859-2b0d78a0-d58e-414d-9148-63c61e302862.png)
This is the first time I've seen a tooltip describe both the problem and the solution. Tested and it fixes both issues. With APPEND it can install multiple extensions at once, but it'll block all future jobs with a failure, either by LuaError or by being offline. With APPEND_OR_REPLACE it can install multiple extensions at once, and if it fails it doesn't affect future installs.

CommitDetails.method_summarization: The change allows ExistingWorkPolicy to append or replace existing data instead of only appending.</s>

I'm unable to directly see or understand the contents of the method code you've provided. However, I can try to help you come up with a one-line summarization of the alteration based on a description of what the changes entailed.

For example, if the before changes method calculates the area of a rectangle using the formula length * width and the after changes method calculates the area of a rectangle using the formula 2 * (length * width), a one-line summarization of the alteration could be: "Multiplied the area calculation of the rectangle by a constant factor of 2."

If you can please provide a brief description of what the changes did, I'll do my best to help you come up with a one-line summarization.</s>The changes convert ClickableText and DropdownMenu inside IconToggleButton to Text and DropdownMenu respectively, with the onClick function applied directly to the Text instead.</s> The changes convert several ClickableText and DropdownMenuItem components into Text and DropdownMenuItem components, respectively, while keeping their functionality for expanding and selecting items.</s>The change converted a ClickableText into a DropdownMenuItem.</s>

issue_title: [Bug] [2.0.0-1677] Offline extension install attempt blocks future online extension installs
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
Attempting to install an extension while offline will bring the app into a state where it is unable to install extensions, even after it's brought back online.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
0. optional: clear app data for a clean test
1. connect to the internet
2. install extension 1
3. disconnect from the internet
4. install extension 2. It fails to install, makes a notification with the error, and a crash dialog.
5. connect to the internet
6. install extension 3. Nothing changes on screen. Scrolling it out of view and back will change the download icon to a loading icon and remove the version number. Going to another tab and back will place the text TODO where the removed version number was.

**Expected behavior**
it pretends the offline extension install attempt never happened and installs extension 1 and also 3

**Screenshots**
If this matches up right, extension 1 succeeded and has a start time, extension 2 had a real offline failure with a start time, then extension 3 had a fake failure with a missing start time… because it never tried?
![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1996449/143320446-6d86405f-6ad8-43fa-9638-4f40093cc51c.png)

**Device information:**
 - OS: 
 - App Version:

**Additional context**
Combined with https://github.com/shosetsuorg/android-app/issues/161 it seems the actual issue is more like:
Failing to install an extension blocks future extension installs

I use PdaNet to connect to a phone hotspot for internet access, and it disconnects out of its own free will, requiring restarting the wifi/client app/host app/cell connection/clearing ram. I think both issues are responsible for my difficulty with writing NOVA.lua, and the other issue took all the blame.

CommitDetails.method_summarization: There were no apparent alterations to the meaning of the method based on the provided code snippets. Both the before and after versions of the method set the ViewTreeLifecycleOwner and ViewTreeSavedStateRegistryOwner, applied a ViewCompositionStrategy, and set the content using MdcTheme and BrowseControllerFilterMenu.</s> The changes made to the method add null check before creating and showing the BottomSheetDialog to avoid showing multiple instances of the dialog at a time.</s> The changes did not affect the meaning of the method significantly, as the code before and after the commit mostly involve setting up the ViewTreeOwner and ViewCompositionStrategy for the binding of a CatalogFilterMenu to the activity's binding and setting its content.</s> The alteration adds a check to create and show the BottomSheetDialog only if it is not already showing.</s> The change created a null check and conditionally re-created and showed theBottomSheetDialog rather than always creating and showing it upon button click.</s>

I'm unable to see the code snippets you've provided. Could you please provide a meaningful one-line summary of the changes based on their functionality instead? For example, "The method now validates user input before processing it" or "The method's logic has been refactored to improve performance". If you can give me a sense of what the method does and how the changes have affected its behavior, I'll do my best to provide an accurate summary.</s>The change converts ClickableTexts in DropdownMenu to Text and DropdownMenuItem instead.</s>Before changes: The method contained a ClickableText, an IconToggleButton, and a DropdownMenu, which could be expanded and collapsed using the IconToggleButton.

After changes: The method was modified to use Text instead of ClickableText for the expandable label, and DropdownMenuItem instead of ClickableText for the items in the DropdownMenu. The behavior of expanding and collapsing the menu remains the same.</s>The change converted a ClickableText component into a DropdownMenuItem component.</s>
